trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of cells in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection> objects are retrieved by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow.Cells%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection"></xref> class.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref> that owns the collection.
Adds a cell to the collection.
Use this method to populate a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow> with cells before you add the row to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control.
Once you add the row to a control, the number of cells it contains always matches the number of columns in the control, so this method is no longer useful.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> to add to the collection.
The position in which to insert the new element.
The row that owns this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection"></xref> already belongs to a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control.
-or-
dataGridViewCell already belongs to a .
Adds an array of cells to the collection.
Use this method to populate a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow> with cells before you add the row to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control.
Once you add the row to a control, the number of cells it contains always matches the number of columns in the control, so this method is no longer useful.
The array of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> objects to add to the collection.
dataGridViewCells is `null`.
The row that owns this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection"></xref> already belongs to a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control.
-or-
At least one value in dataGridViewCells is `null`.
-or-
At least one cell in dataGridViewCells already belongs to a .
-or-
At least two values in dataGridViewCells are references to the same .
Clears all cells from the collection.
Use this method to alter the collection before you add the containing row to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control.
Once you add the row to a control, the number of cells it contains always matches the number of columns in the control, so this method is no longer useful.
The row that owns this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection"></xref> already belongs to a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control.
Occurs when the collection is changed.
Determines whether the specified cell is contained in the collection.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> to locate in the collection.
`true` if dataGridViewCell is in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Copies the entire collection of cells into an array at a specified location within the array.
The destination array to which the contents will be copied.
The index of the element in array at which to start copying.
Returns the index of the specified cell.
The cell to locate in the collection.
The zero-based index of the value of dataGridViewCell parameter, if it is found in the collection; otherwise, -1.
Inserts a cell into the collection at the specified index.
Use this method to alter the collection before you add the containing row to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control.
Once you add the row to a control, the number of cells it contains always matches the number of columns in the control, so this method is no longer useful.
The zero-based index at which to place dataGridViewCell.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> to insert.
The row that owns this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection"></xref> already belongs to a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control.
-or-
dataGridViewCell already belongs to a .
Gets or sets the cell at the provided index location.
In C#, this property is the indexer for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection"></xref> class.
The zero-based index of the cell to get or set.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> stored at the given index.
The specified value when setting this property is `null`.
The specified cell when setting this property already belongs to a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control.
-or-
The specified cell when setting this property already belongs to a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref>.
index is less than 0.
-or-
index is equal to or greater than the number of cells in the collection.
Gets or sets the cell in the column with the provided name.
In C#, this property is the indexer for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection"></xref> class.
The name of the column in which to get or set the cell.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> stored in the column with the given name.
columnName does not match the name of any columns in the control.
The specified value when setting this property is `null`.
The specified cell when setting this property already belongs to a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control.
-or-
The specified cell when setting this property already belongs to a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref>.
Gets an <xref href="System.Collections.ArrayList"></xref> containing <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection"></xref> objects.
<xref href="System.Collections.ArrayList"></xref>.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection.CollectionChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection.OnCollectionChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.CollectionChangeEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Removes the specified cell from the collection.
Use this method to alter the collection before you add the containing row to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control.
Once you add the row to a control, the number of cells it contains always matches the number of columns in the control, so this method is no longer useful.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> to remove from the collection.
The row that owns this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection"></xref> already belongs to a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control.
cell could not be found in the collection.
Removes the cell at the specified index.
Use this method to alter the collection before you add the containing row to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control.
Once you add the row to a control, the number of cells it contains always matches the number of columns in the control, so this method is no longer useful.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> to be removed.
The row that owns this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection"></xref> already belongs to a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control.
Copies the elements of the collection to the specified array, starting at the specified index.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the collection.
The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in the array at which copying begins.
array is `null`.
index is less than zero.
array is multidimensional.
-or-
The number of elements in the is greater than the available space from index to the end of array.
The cannot be cast automatically to the type of array.
Gets the number of elements contained in the collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
The number of elements in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether access to the collection is synchronized (thread safe).
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
`false` in all cases.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection"></xref>.
Returns an enumerator that iterates through a collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that can be used to iterate through the collection.
Adds an item to the collection.
Once you add the row to a control, the number of cells it contains always matches the number of columns in the control, so this method is no longer useful.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> to add to the collection.
The position into which the new element was inserted.
value is not a .
The row that owns this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection"></xref> already belongs to a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control.
-or-
value represents a cell that already belongs to a .
Clears the collection.
Once you add the row to a control, the number of cells it contains always matches the number of columns in the control, so this method is no longer useful.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The row that owns this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection"></xref> already belongs to a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control.
Determines whether the collection contains the specified value.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The object to locate in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection"></xref>.
`true` if the value is found in the ; otherwise, `false`.
Determines the index of a specific item in a collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The object to locate in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection"></xref>.
The index of value if found in the list; otherwise, -1.
Inserts an item into the collection at the specified position.
Once you add the row to a control, the number of cells it contains always matches the number of columns in the control, so this method is no longer useful.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index at which value should be inserted.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> to insert into the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection.System#Collections#IList#Insert(System.Int32,System.Object)"></xref>.
value is not a .
The row that owns this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection"></xref> already belongs to a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control.

dataGridViewCell already belongs to a .
Gets a value indicating whether the collection has a fixed size.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
`false` in all cases.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection has a fixed size.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
`false` in all cases.
Gets or sets the element at the specified index.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The index of the item to get or set.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> at the specified index.
The specified value when setting this property is not a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref>.
The specified value when setting this property is `null`.
The specified cell when setting this property already belongs to a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control.
-or-
The specified cell when setting this property already belongs to a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref>.
index is less than 0.
-or-
index is equal to or greater than the number of cells in the collection.
Removes the first occurrence of a specific object from the collection.
Once you add the row to a control, the number of cells it contains always matches the number of columns in the control, so this method is no longer useful.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.

cell could not be found in the collection.
Removes the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> at the specified index.

This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The position at which to remove the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref>.
